Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: They won’t stop me, but I can see how it would stop others
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: They won’t stop me, but I can see how it would stop others; Trans voters can obtain a U.S. passport or passport card that reflects their gender identity without needing to provide underlying documentation

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Trans people, just like everyone else, want to be able to travel, start new jobs, open bank accounts, enroll in school, vote — all of those things require some form of ID
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Trans people, just like everyone else, want to be able to travel, start new jobs, open bank accounts, enroll in school, vote — all of those things require some form of ID; Forcing a person to show identification that does not align with their gender identity could out them to people in their community

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “Gender nonconforming people are already under such public scrutiny nationwide”
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Gender nonconforming people are already under such public scrutiny nationwide; That’s when you’re gonna see the convergence of those two elements

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “It really seems like it would only result in more discrimination, more discomfort for trans people, more interrogation and potentially just being turned away”
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: It really seems like it would only result in more discrimination, more discomfort for trans people, more interrogation and potentially just being turned away; Such rhetoric could also be most dangerous in states where far-right groups are trying to recruit poll watchers

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Black and Hispanic people are among those most likely not to have a current license, so the requirement harms them too, regardless of their gender identity
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Black and Hispanic people are among those most likely not to have a current license, so the requirement harms them too, regardless of their gender identity; Nearly 21 million voting-eligible U.S. citizens do not have a current driver’s license

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to a tally by the Movement Advancement Project (MAP), which tracks LGBTQ+ policy
Document Sources.Source Justification: At least nine states in the past two years have explicitly regulated gender in this way; According to a tally by the Movement Advancement Project (MAP), which tracks LGBTQ+ policy

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The Williams Institute at the University of California, Los Angeles School of Law, estimated ahead of the 2022 midterm election that more than 200,000 voting-eligible transgender Americans may find it difficult to vote at the time because of voter ID laws
Document Sources.Name of Source: The Williams Institute at the University of California, Los Angeles School of Law
Document Sources.Source Justification: The Williams Institute at the University of California, Los Angeles School of Law, estimated ahead of the 2022 midterm election that more than 200,000 voting-eligible transgender Americans may find it difficult to vote at the time because of voter ID laws; The full impact of these laws amid new and evolving voter identification laws is not yet clear

Named Person Sources.Title of Source: CEO and executive director of VoteRiders
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Lauren Kunis, CEO and executive director of VoteRiders, which helps voters obtain identification; There is an unsafe and intimidating environment around existing as trans in society, and definitely in being able to go to the polls safely and cast a ballot

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “A lot is falling on poll workers to correctly enforce the law”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: CEO and executive director of VoteRiders
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Lauren Kunis, CEO and executive director of VoteRiders, which helps voters obtain identification; A lot is falling on poll workers to correctly enforce the law

Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of research for the National Center for Transgender Equality
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Ankit Rastogi, director of research for the National Center for Transgender Equality, which conducted the survey and will soon be known as Advocates for Trans Equality Education Fund; I think the big takeaway is that our community is really trying to come out and make a difference through the democratic process

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Trans people, just like everyone else, want to be able to travel, start new jobs, open bank accounts, enroll in school, vote — all of those things require some form of ID”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: attorney for the ACLU of Tennessee
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Lucas Cameron-Vaughn, an attorney for the ACLU of Tennessee; Forcing a person to show identification that does not align with their gender identity could out them to people in their community

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s a tactic that’s designed to splinter support for trans rights and suggest sort of who is harmed by protecting trans people — to frame that as cisgender women being the people harmed by protections for trans people”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: deputy project director for the ACLU’s LGBT & HIV Project
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Rose Saxe, who is deputy project director for the ACLU’s LGBT & HIV Project; It’s a tactic that’s designed to splinter support for trans rights and suggest sort of who is harmed by protecting trans people — to frame that as cisgender women being the people harmed by protections for trans people

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We saw it as a move to inflict maximum chaos and misunderstanding”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Quinn Diaz, a public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida; We saw it as a move to inflict maximum chaos and misunderstanding

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “With these laws in Florida, you’re forced to choose between living authentically and just not really participating in public life”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Quinn Diaz, a public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida; With these laws in Florida, you’re forced to choose between living authentically and just not really participating in public life

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I can imagine that a lot of trans folks in Florida who might not have access … to an accurate and affirming ID might not want to engage in that process at all, especially in such a heightened political environment”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Quinn Diaz, a public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida; I can imagine that a lot of trans folks in Florida who might not have access … to an accurate and affirming ID might not want to engage in that process at all, especially in such a heightened political environment

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Our ability to participate in this democracy in Florida, it’s been on the line for a while”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Quinn Diaz, a public policy associate at advocacy group Equality Florida; Our ability to participate in this democracy in Florida, it’s been on the line for a while

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There’s nothing these laws will do to stop me from living my best life”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Hazel Krebs, a 42-year-old transgender woman living in Kansas, one of the states with a new anti-trans law; There’s nothing these laws will do to stop me from living my best life

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It is almost certainly stopping some people from showing up at the polls”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Hazel Krebs, a 42-year-old transgender woman living in Kansas, one of the states with a new anti-trans law; It is almost certainly stopping some people from showing up at the polls

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It really shows the resiliency of the trans community to ensure that our voices are heard and we have visibility at the ballot box”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of voting and elections for the group that conducted the 2022 U.S. Transgender Survey
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Josie Caballero, director of voting and elections for the group that conducted the 2022 U.S. Transgender Survey; It really shows the resiliency of the trans community to ensure that our voices are heard and we have visibility at the ballot box

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Lawyers for the American Civil Liberties Union have drafted a letter reminding election workers that a gender marker on a person’s identification does not need to match or correspond to a voter’s gender expression
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: In Kansas, lawyers for the American Civil Liberties Union have drafted a letter reminding election workers that a gender marker on a person’s identification does not need to match or correspond to a voter’s gender expression; Staff for the organization have also held clinics elsewhere to prepare trans Americans for the identification requirements they will have to navigate

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The nonprofit VoteRiders is on the ground helping voters get the identification they need to cast ballots in the November election — and one that reflects who they are
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: In eight battleground states, the nonprofit VoteRiders is on the ground helping voters get the identification they need to cast ballots in the November election — and one that reflects who they are; VoteRiders is conducting year-round voter education

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Equality Florida, the state’s leading LGBTQ+ advocacy group, is holding “know your rights” trainings in the wake of new regulations barring many transgender voters from obtaining photo identification that reflects their gender
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Equality Florida, the state’s leading LGBTQ+ advocacy group, is holding “know your rights” trainings in the wake of new regulations barring many transgender voters from obtaining photo identification that reflects their gender; The failure of most anti-LGBTQ+ bills introduced in this year’s legislative session showed that the tide in Florida is turning

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The ACLU sued the agency for discrimination, claiming the rule was adopted illegally because it didn’t follow proper administrative procedure
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Last year, Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee, a Republican, signed a bill into law that defines sex as “determined by anatomy and genetics existing at the time of birth”; The ACLU sued the agency for discrimination, claiming the rule was adopted illegally because it didn’t follow proper administrative procedure

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The National Center for Transgender Equality, which conducted the survey and will soon be known as Advocates for Trans Equality Education Fund
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Ankit Rastogi, director of research for the National Center for Transgender Equality, which conducted the survey and will soon be known as Advocates for Trans Equality Education Fund; I think the big takeaway is that our community is really trying to come out and make a difference through the democratic process
